creditline: The Driscoll Art Accessions Endowment Fund and bequest of Virginia Doneghy, by exchange
dimension:
39 3/16 × 19 in. (99.5 × 48.3 cm)
13 1/16 × 18 1/16 in. (33.2 × 45.9 cm) (object part, top sheet)
12 1/16 × 19 in. (30.6 × 48.3 cm) (object part, second sheet from top)
9 1/2 × 12 in. (24.1 × 30.5 cm) (object part, second sheet from bottom)
4 13/16 × 12 1/16 in. (12.2 × 30.6 cm) (object part, bottom sheet)
medium: Colored pencil and pigments on paper
text: Vining patterns in shades of green emerge from five hearts. The central heart is blue, the top hearts, each in a corner, are green, and in the bottom corners are two yellow hearts. White wings attached to the upper portion of each heart.  The middle panel is boldly geometric, with a predominant vertical zigzag pattern forming the composition. The hearts have been turned sideways and flattened. The bottom pattern grounds the subject as a tree of life; from a single vertical stem are green branches with heart-shaped leaves growing from each. The leaves are further elaborated with additional floral forms
title: Spring
